messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
My girlfriend, she's not breathing!
I don't know. I'm trying to catch up with his ambulance. I can't take her pulse or I'm sorry.
Listen, calm down. We're dispatching the ambulance so it can stop and meet you at 26 of 100, all right?
What's your name?
My name is Thomas. Please have the ambulance stop.
What kind of car are you in?
I'm in an extended cab, F-150.
What color is your truck?
Blue, it's blue.
All right, calm down. All right, what's happening?
My girlfriend has just been shot!
Yes, the ambulance stopped up ahead. I just ran up here.
Okay. Now that the ambulance is there, let them take care of her. Talk to me about the suspect.
What kind of vehicle was the suspect in?
It was a red Ranger, like an old beat-up red Ranger.
And you said this occurred further down on 26?
Yes, down on 26. We were on our way to Gainesville.
She just took a deep breath. Oh, my God.
Okay. And the ambulance is checking her out now, right?
Yes.
Good. Now, do you have any idea who the suspect is?
No, I've never seen him before in my life.
Did they leave right after that?

Yes, they shot her. I put my truck in reverse. I gave him my wallet, he grabbed her purse, she tried grabbing him, and then he shot her. I put my truck in reverse and just took off. I'm sorry, I had to go.
Okay, so he did take your wallet. Did he get her purse too?
He got her purse, yes.
Can you tell me what he looked like?
Calm down. Can you describe him?
Yeah, he was black. He was wearing a black shirt and a gray hoodie.
Hang on just a second.
Yes, sir.
